channel.title: Decentralizing Capitalism
channel.description: An ambitious community-driven show inspired by the reshaping our capital markets, monetary system, and labor organization. Driven by the ethos of decentralizing knowledge, founder John Wooten aims to make investments as accessible and open to everyone as information and money are through TCP/IP and blockchain. You can join our mission of empowering the next generation by adding your own episode through a PR on this show's GitHub page. Tune in to learn how you can be part of this revolutionary movement towards a decentralized economy.
channel.itunes:author: Community Contributors

item.title: John Wooten at al: New SEC Short-Sale Reporting Rules and Implications | Ankit Sehgal
item.description: Discusses the intricacies of the new short sale reporting rules, which were delayed by up to a year just four days after this recording. We also chat on currency decentralization.

item.title: John Wooten at al: What is Decentralization? Case Study of an Onchain Launch After Gensler | Ankit Sehgal
item.description: Today we dive into the recent public offering of an AI company through a coin listed on Coinbase within hours of trading. John contemplates the implications of insider trading activity on decentralized exchanges, which was centrally investigated and punished by an underlying core team. We extrapolate this turn of events to ask ourselves, "What is decentralization," with plenty of stories to go along from community contributors!

item.title: John Wooten: Regulation Showdown Between FINRA, the SEC, and Congress | Ankit Sehgal
item.description: In exploring the past of securities regulations and their general social frameworks, we discuss often-overlooked key goals of public policy as developed over the course of centuries. Looking forward, we finish with a chat on the regulation of TAD3 using a first-of-its-kind DUNA community reconciliation model. Uncover the principles behind today's best practices that just might leave you scratching your head.

item.title: John Wooten et al: ETF and Central Banking Abuse Methods Demystified | Ankit Sehgal
item.description: This episode delves into the detailed mechanisms of exchange-traded funds in the context of central banking practices, examining the role of centralized credit unions, the structuring of fiat access systems, and the sophisticated processes of block creation and redemption often leveraged in strategies like short selling. By unpacking these interconnected systems, we uncover the underlying dynamics shaping financial market operations and their broader implications.

item.title: John Wooten et al: How Should We Govern the Financial System? | Ankit Sehgal
item.description: In this episode, we examine the emergence of new banking structures and the foundational role governance plays in their success. We highlight the launch of the first American DUNA (nonprofit DAO) organization, a pioneering effort to redefine financial networks through transparent, decentralized systems. From the challenges of aligning stakeholders to the critical importance of system governance, we explore how these innovative structures are reshaping the financial landscape and creating new opportunities for inclusivity and accountability.

item.title: John Wooten: Global Moves to Curtail U.S. Investor Protections | Ankit Sehgal
item.description: In this episode, we explore how Singapore, Switzerland, and China are leveraging tokenized treasuries and blockchain innovations to sidestep traditional U.S. investor protection laws. Using UBS's upcoming tokenized treasuries as a case study, we analyze the global shift in financial strategies and what it means for American investors.

item.title: Genesis: Why Decentralize Capitalism? | John Wooten
item.description: In this episode, we discuss the inspiration of this show.
